self.philbrown.droidQuery
Class $

java.lang.Object
  self.philbrown.droidQuery.$

public class $
extends java.lang.Object

droidQuery

An Android port of jQuery. Supports Android API 2.2 (Froyo) and up.

Author:
Phil Brown

Nested Class Summary

          Data types for ajax request responses

          Relates to the interpolator used for droidQuery animations

with

public static $ with(java.util.List<View> views)
Convenience method for initializing a droidQuery Object. For example: 
        List<View> list = new ArrayList<View>();
        //manipute the list
        $.with(list);

Parameters:
views -
Returns:
a new droidQuery instance

with

public static $ with(View... views)
Convenience method for initializing a droidQuery Object. For example: 
        View[] views = new View[10];
        //manipute the array
        $.with(views).attr("alpha", 0.5);
or 
 TextView tv = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.textview);
 ImageView img = (ImageView) findViewById(R.id.img);
 $.with(tv, img).attr("alpha", 0.5);

Parameters:
views -
Returns:
a new droidQuery instance

 $.with(this).id(R.id.main)

animate

public $ animate(java.lang.String properties,
                 long duration,
                 $.Easing easing,
                 Function complete)
Animates the selected views using the JSON properties, the given duration, the easing function, and with the onComplete callback

Parameters:
properties - JSON String of an AnimationOptions Object
duration - the duration of the animation, in milliseconds
easing - the Easing function to use
complete - the Function to invoke once the animation has completed for all views
Returns:
this
See Also:
$.Easing, animate(Map, long, Easing, Function), animate(String, AnimationOptions), animate(Map, AnimationOptions)

animate

public $ animate(java.lang.String properties,
                 AnimationOptions options)
Animate the current views. Example: 
 $.with(mView).animate("{
                           left: 1000px,
                           top: 0%,
                           width: 50%,
                           alpha: 0.5
                        }", 
                        new AnimationOptions("{ duration: 3000,
                                                easing: linear
                                            }").complete(new Function() {
                                                                        public void invoke($ droidQuery, Object... args) {
                                                                                droidQuery.alert("Animation Complete!");
                                                                        }
                                                                  });

Parameters:
properties - to animate, in CSS representation
options - the AnimationOptions for the animation
Returns:
this

animate

public $ animate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                 long duration,
                 $.Easing easing,
                 Function complete)
Animate the currently selected views. For example: 
 $.with(myView).animate(new QuickMap(QuickEntry.qe("alpha", .8f), QuickEntry.qe("width", 50%)), 400, Easing.LINEAR, null);

Parameters:
properties - mapping of AnimationOptions attributes
duration - the length of time for the animation to last
easing - the Easing to use to interpolate the animation
complete - the Function to call once the animation has completed or has been canceled.
Returns:
this
See Also:
QuickMap

                                          java.lang.String key,
                                          java.lang.String _value)

_value - the end animation value

the computed value

animate

public $ animate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                 AnimationOptions options)

Parameters:

                       Function complete)
For each selected view, if its alpha is less than 0.5, it will fade in. Otherwise, it will fade out.

Parameters:

Parameters:
options - use to modify the behavior of the animation

public java.lang.Object attr(java.lang.String s)

bind

public $ bind(java.lang.String eventType,
              java.lang.Object data,
              Function handler)
Binds the views in the current selection to the event. For example: 
 $.with(myView).bind("click", "Hello World!", new Function() {
        public void invoke($ droidQuery, Object... args) {
                Object data = args[0];
                droidQuery.alert((String) data);
        }
 });

Parameters:
eventType - should be the verb in OnVerbListener
data - an Object passed to handler when the event is triggered.
handler - receives two arguments: a droidQuery with the affected view selected, and the data parameter
Returns:
the current instance of droidQuery
See Also:
on(String, Function), one(String, Function), unbind(String)

on

public $ on(java.lang.String event,
            Function handler)
Binds the views in the current selection to the event. For example: 
 $.with(myView).on("click", new Function() {
        public void invoke($ droidQuery, Object... args) {
                droidQuery.alert("View Clicked!");
        }
 });

Parameters:
event - should be the verb in OnVerbListener
handler - receives one argument: a droidQuery with the affected view selected
Returns:
the current instance of droidQuery
See Also:
bind(String, Object, Function), one(String, Function), unbind(String)

one

public $ one(java.lang.String event,
             Function handler)
Like on(String, Function), but the function will only run once for the event. Future events will not trigger the given function

Parameters:
event - the name of the event
handler - the function to invoke the first time the event occurs
Returns:
this

change

public $ change(Function function)
Registers change listeners for TextViews, EditTexts, and CompoundButtons. For all other view types, this will trigger a function when the view's layout has been changed.

Parameters:
function - the Function to call when the change event occurs. This will receive a droidQuery instance for the changed view
Returns:
this

val

public java.lang.Object val()
Get the value associated with the first view in the current selection. If the view is a TextView, this method returns the CharSequence text. If it is a Button, the boolean checked state is returned. If it is an ImageView, the Drawable is returned.

Returns:
the value of this view, or null if not applicable.

val

public $ val(java.lang.Object object)
Set the value associated with the views in the current selection. If the view is a TextView, this method sets the CharSequence text. If it is a Button, the boolean checked state is set. If it is an ImageView, the Drawable or Bitmap is set. All other view types are ignored.

Returns:
this

public void unbind(java.lang.String eventType)
Remove a previously-attached event handler from the views in the current selection. This can remove events registered by bind(String, Object, Function), on(String, Function), click(), etc.- or directly on the view.

Parameters:

each

public $ each(Function function)
Invokes the given function for each view in the current selection. Function receives a droidQuery instance containing the single view, and an integer of the current index

Parameters:
function - the function to invoke
Returns:
this

children

public $ children(Function function)
If the first view of the current selection is a subclass of AdapterView, this will loop through all the adapter data and invoke the given function, passing the varargs:
  1. the item from the adapter
  2. the index
Otherwise, if the first view in the current selection is a subclass of ViewGroup, each will loop through all the child views, and wrap each one in a droidQuery object. The invoked function will receive it, and an int for the index of the selected child view.

Parameters:
function - Function the function to invoke
Returns:
this

siblings

public $ siblings(Function function)
Loops through all the sibling views of the first view in the current selection, and wraps each in a droidQuery object. When invoked, the given function will receive two parameters:
  1. the droidQuery for the view
  2. the child index of the sibling

Parameters:
function - receives the droidQuery for the view, and the index for arg1

slice

public $ slice(int start)
Gets all the views in the current selection after the given start index

Parameters:
start - the starting position of the views to pass to the new instance of droidQuery.
Returns:
a droidQuery object containing the views from start to the end of the list.

               int end)

Parameters:
start - the starting position of the views to pass to the new instance of droidQuery.
Returns:
a droidQuery object containing the views from start to end.

intersect

public $ intersect($ other$)
Select the intersection of this droidQuery's selection with another droidQuery's selection. This is a costly operation, with a time-complexity of O(n^2).

Parameters:
other$ - the droidQuery which which to intersect
Returns:
a new droidQuery instance containing a selection of Views only found in both droidQuery instances.

union

public $ union($ other$)
Select the union of this droidQuery's selection with another droidQuery's selection.

Parameters:
other$ - the droidQuery which which to merge
Returns:
a new droidQuery instance containing a selection of all Views found in each droidQuery instances.

intersect

public static $ intersect($ a,
                          $ b)
Select the intersection two droidQuery's selections. This is a costly operation, with a time-complexity of O(n^2).

Parameters:
a -
b -
Returns:
a new droidQuery instance containing a selection of Views only found in both droidQuery instances.

union

public static $ union($ a,
                      $ b)
Select the union of two droidQuery's selections

Parameters:
a -
b -

a new droidQuery instance containing a selection of all Views found in each droidQuery instances.

extend

public static void extend(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String clazz)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                          java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                          java.lang.InstantiationException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Add an extension with the reference name

Parameters:
name - String used by the #ext(String) method for calling this extension
clazz - the name of the subclass of $Extension that will be mapped to name. Calling $.with(this).ext(myExtension); will now create a new instance of the given clazz, passing in this instance of $, then calling the invoke method.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if clazz is not a valid class name, or if it is not a subclass of $Extension.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException

extend

public static void extend(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                          java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
Add an extension with the reference name

Parameters:
name - String used by the #ext(String) method for calling this extension
clazz - subclass of $Extension that will be mapped to name. Calling $.with(this).ext(MyExtension.class); will now create a new instance of the given clazz, passing in this instance of $, then calling the invoke method.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if clazz is not a valid class name, or if it is not a subclass of $Extension.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException

ext

public $Extension ext(java.lang.String extension,
                      java.lang.Object... args)
Load the extension with the name defined in extend(String, String)

Parameters:

Returns:
the new extension instance

write

public void write(byte[] s,
                  $.FileLocation path,
                  java.lang.String fileName,
                  boolean append,
                  boolean async)
Write a byte stream to file

Parameters:
s - the bytes to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new data to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.

write

public void write(java.lang.String s,
                  $.FileLocation path,
                  java.lang.String fileName,
                  boolean append,
                  boolean async)
Write a String to file

Parameters:
s - the String to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new String to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.

write

public void write(java.lang.String s,
                  $.FileLocation path,
                  java.lang.String fileName,
                  boolean append,
                  boolean async,
                  Function success,
                  Function error)
Write a String to file, and execute functions once complete.

Parameters:
s - the String to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new String to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.
success - Function to invoke on a successful file-write. Parameters received will be:
  1. the String to write
  2. the File that was written (to)
error - Function to invoke on a file I/O error. Parameters received will be:
  1. the String to write
  2. the String reason

write

public void write(byte[] s,
                  $.FileLocation path,
                  java.lang.String fileName,
                  boolean append,
                  boolean async,
                  Function success,
                  Function error)
Write a byte stream to file, and execute functions once complete.

Parameters:
s - the bytes to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new bytes to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.
success - Function to invoke on a successful file-write. Parameters received will be:
  1. the byte[] to write
  2. the path to the file
error - Function to invoke on a file I/O error. Parameters received will be:
  1. the byte[] to write
  2. the path to the file

makeArray

public static JSONArray makeArray(java.lang.Object[] array)
Convert an Object Array to a JSONArray

Parameters:
array - an Object[] containing any of: JSONObject, JSONArray, String, Boolean, Integer, Long, Double, NULL, or null. May not include NaNs or infinities. Unsupported values are not permitted and will cause the JSONArray to be in an inconsistent state.
Returns:
the newly-created JSONArray Object

ajaxPrefilter

public static void ajaxPrefilter(Function prefilter)
Handle custom Ajax options or modify existing options before each request is sent and before they are processed by $.ajax(). Note that this will be run in the background thread, so any changes to the UI must be made through a call to Activity.runOnUiThread().

Parameters:
prefilter - Function that will receive one Map argument with the following contents:
  • "options" : AjaxOptions for the request
  • "request" : HttpClient request Object

                 java.lang.Object data,
                 Function complete)
Load data from the server and place the returned HTML into the matched element

html

public $ html(int resourceID)
Include the html string in the selected views. If a view has a setText method, it is used. Otherwise, a new TextView is created. This html can also handle image tags for both urls and local files. Local files should be the name (for example, for R.id.ic_launcher, just use ic_launcher).

Parameters:
resourceID - the ID of the String resource

html

public $ html(java.lang.String html)
Include the html string the selected views. If a view has a setText method, it is used. Otherwise, a new TextView is created. This html can also handle image tags for both urls and local files. Local files should be the name (for example, for R.id.ic_launcher, just use ic_launcher).

Parameters:
html - the HTML String to include

Parameters:
resourceId - resource ID of the text to include

image

public $ image(java.lang.String source,
               int width,
               int height,
               Function error)
For `ImageView`s, this will set the image to the given asset or url. Otherwise, it will set the background image for the selected views.

Parameters:
source - asset path, file path (starting with "file://") or URL to image
width - specifies the output bitmap width
height - specifies the output bitmap height
error - if the given source is a file or asset, this receives a droidQuery wrapping the current context and the Throwable error. Otherwise, this will receive an Ajax error.
Returns:
this
See Also:
AjaxOptions.error(Function)

image

               int width,
               int height,
               Function error)

Parameters:
sources - the file paths or URLs to set
width - the output width of the image
height - the output height of the image
error - if the given source is a file or asset, this receives a droidQuery wrapping the current context and the Throwable error. Otherwise, this will receive an Ajax error.
Returns:
this
See Also:
AjaxOptions.error(Function)

mask

public $ mask(int resourceId)
Adds an Image over each selected View as a mask. In most cases, this mask can be retrieved by querying siblings. For example: 
 ImageView mask = (ImageView) $.with(myView).parent().selectChildren().selectImages().view(0);

Parameters:
resourceId - the resource ID of the mask drawable
Returns:
this

Callbacks

public static Callbacks Callbacks()
A multi-purpose callbacks list object that provides a powerful way to manage callback lists. Registered callback functions will receive a null for their droidQuery variable. To receive a non-null variable, you must provide a Context.

Returns:
a new instance of Callbacks
See Also:
Callbacks(Context)

Callbacks

public static Callbacks Callbacks(Context context)
A multi-purpose callbacks list object that provides a powerful way to manage callback lists. If context is not null, Functions invoked will receive a non-null droidQuery instance using that context.

Returns:
a new instance of Callbacks

setTimeout

public static java.util.Timer setTimeout(Function function,
                                         long delay)
Schedule a task for single execution after a specified delay.

Parameters:
function - the task to schedule. Receives no args. Note that the function will be run on the thread on this method was called.
delay - amount of time in milliseconds before execution.
Returns:
the created Timer

setInterval

public static java.util.Timer setInterval(Function function,
                                          long delay)
Schedule a task for repeated fixed-rate execution after a specific delay has passed.

Parameters:
the - task to schedule. Receives no args. Note that the function will be run on a the thread on which this method was called.
delay - amount of time in milliseconds before execution.
Returns:
the created Timer
